thread.title: Networking: The return of Russell Coight and more TV news
thread.title_full: Networking: The return of Russell Coight and more TV news

author: Michael Idato
title: Networking: The return of Russell Coight and more TV news
text:
Debra-Jo (Faith Seci) in Little Lunch , which has been sold to Netflix to stream in the US and Britain. 
Food for thought at SBS 
SBS will partner with the US-based Scripps Networks to develop a food-themed channel as part of the network's digital multi-channel offering. The as-yet-unnamed channel will be carried on the SBS3 signal and will join SBS's suite of channels, SBS1, SBS2 and NITV, from November. SBS managing director Michael Ebeid said food was one the channel's "strongest and well-known genres". Scripps owns the US Food Network, HGTV, DIY Network and Travel Channel.
Russell's return 
Glenn Robbins as Russell Coight. 
One of the Ten Network's iconic comedy characters, television adventurer Russell Coight​, will be resurrected for what appears to be a single evening engagement: an appearance on Ten's Have You Been Paying Attention? Coight, who is played by comedian Glenn Robbins, featured in his own television series, All Aussie Adventures . Coight will join host Tom Gleisner and panelists Jane Kennedy, Sam Pang and Ed Kavalee this week.
Advertisement Colvin off air 
The ABC's respected PM program host Mark Colvin is raking long service leave and will be off the airwaves from October until the end of January, 2016. A spokesperson for the ABC said Colvin would be "writing on his rich and varied career in journalism" during his break. The PM program will be presented by former Foreign Correspondent , producer and award-winning reporter Tim Palmer from October 5.


Return of the King 
Filming on the second season of the ABC's critically acclaimed drama Janet King begins this week. The series, which was written by Greg Haddrick, Stuart Page, Niki Aken and Felicity Packard, stars Marta Dusseldorp​. Eight one-hour episodes have been commissioned by the ABC. The series also stars Damian Walshe-Howling, Aaron Jeffrey and Nicholas Hope. Haddrick, also the show's executive producer said he was "delighted to be bringing back [ Janet King ] for an explosive second season".
Little goes big 
The television comedy Little Lunch , from the Melbourne-based production company Gristmill, has been sold to the streaming service Netflix for its US and British services. The series is making its official international launch this week at the annual television market Mipcom in Cannes, France, but the Netflix deal was finalised ahead of the market. Little Lunch aired in Australia on ABC3. Gristmill's next project is the feature film Now Add Honey, starring Robyn Butler, Portia de Rossi and Hamish Blake.
Boxing on 
The original cast of the iconic Australian soap opera The Box will reunite at a special 40th anniversary screening of the feature film based on the series. Among those attending the reunion are Judy Nunn, Tracy Mann, Cornelia Frances, Geraldine Turner and Lois Ramsey. The series, set behind the scenes of a TV network, was aired in the 1970s by Channel Ten and, like Number 96 , was a racy, raunchy soap. For more information see backdoorcinema.com.au .
